title: Victory and the Bronze Snake
summary: Numbers 21 recounts Israel’s victories over enemies like the Canaanites, Amorites, and King Og. It also tells of the people complaining again, leading God to send venomous snakes. When they repent, God tells Moses to raise a bronze snake for healing.

faq.question: Why did God send snakes among the people?
faq.answer: Because they complained against Him and Moses again.

faq.question: How were people healed from the snake bites?
faq.answer: By looking at the bronze snake Moses lifted on a pole—an act of faith and obedience.
